title: Graph of Polar Function - Restricted Domain

content.description:
The polar function consists of four loops, right, left, top, bottom, each of which begins at the origin, the center of the polar grid, labeled point E.

Two of the loops, right and left, have a horizontal orientation.

The loop on the right moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing radii of 1 and 2, to a maximum distance from the polar axis.

From the maximum distance from the polar axis, the loop on the right moves downward and to the right, passing through the radius of 3, until it reaches the radius of 4.

The loop on the right has symmetry over the polar axis.

The loop on the left is a reflection of the loop on the right over the vertical axis.

Two of the loops, top and bottom, have a vertical orientation.

The loop on the top moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing radii of 1 and 2, to a maximum distance from the vertical axis.

From the maximum distance from the vertical axis, the loop on the top moves upward and to the left, passing through radius of 3, until it reaches the radius of 4.

The loop on the top has symmetry over the vertical axis.

The loop on the bottom is a reflection of the loop on the top over the polar axis.

The four other labeled points are located as follows, clockwise from left to right.

A is on the polar axis, on the left loop, and on the radius of 4.

B is on the vertical axis, on the top loop, and on the radius of 4.

C is on the polar axis, on the right loop, and on the radius of 4.

D is on the vertical axis, on the bottom loop, and on the radius of 4.

The figure shows the graph of the polar function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals 4 cos open parentheses 2 theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in the polar coordinate system for <math alttext="0 less or equal than theta less or equal than 2 pi"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. There are five points labeled <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="C"><semantics><mi>C</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="D"><semantics><mi>D</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. If the domain of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is restricted to <math alttext="0 less or equal than theta less or equal than pi over 2"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, the portion of the given graph that remains consists of two pieces. One of those pieces is the portion of the graph in Quadrant I from <math alttext="C"><semantics><mi>C</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math alttext="E"> <semantics> <mi>E</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question: Which of the following describes the other remaining piece?

choices.label: ​The portion of the graph in Quadrant I from <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​The portion of the graph in Quadrant II from <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​​The portion of the graph in Quadrant III from <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​​The portion of the graph in Quadrant III from <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math alttext="D"><semantics><mi>D</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​​​The portion of the graph in Quadrant III from <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math alttext="D"><semantics><mi>D</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
